RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 55. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICONIC BONNET broke into the four path a bit was quickly corrected, vied for the lead, took the rail and was matching strides with another foe to the out side, these two raced as a set past the half and three eighths poles, the rail gave ICONIC BONNET a slight edge entering the stretch, her company was still a threat, with some encouragement from the right handed crop she was kept on point and continued to battle with her rival until the furlong ground where she was finally able to shake the rival who had been by her side through out and drew away for the game win. VALENTINE ANGEL raced two wide, vied for the lead, matched strides with an inside foe and raced as a set through out, was asked and responded at the quarter pole, but she couldn't over come the eventual winner and tired late. LOVELY JOYCE was off a step slow, found her best stride after the half mile pole, was racing three wide then shifted into the five path where she was kept on point and drive, was able to pick up the pieces and score third place honors. ROSALIE'S DESTINY was off a bit slow, raced on the rail but made no impact. BLUE COWGIRL raced three wide, challenged for the lead and tired by the quarter pole. SPARKLE CITY showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Rosalie's Destiny
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, rail, made no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Lovely Joyce
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slw, off pace, 3w, stride 1/2, 5w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Iconic Bonnet
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, led, rail, drew away

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 5F Turf CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) ( Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PIECE OF ME was sharp out of the gated, quicky established the lead on the rail, used her natural speed to establish her dominance and went uncontested. Earning a very nicely done win. IRISH WRIT was off a bit slow, angled in and raced from the three path while stalking, was encouraged to get involved by the half, was gaining ground and smartly angled in to the rail, saved ground leaving the the bend, and had clean racing room up the fence and accelerated like a favorite, chased down the lane but had to much to do and settled for second today. SHESTHEBIGGAME broke into the two path and pushed the two horse into the three path, was finally pointed down the track and found the rail, settled well off the pace and found her stride inching forward and gaining ground, was mid pack and gaining as she past the three eighths pole, angled out into the three path att he quarter pole chased the leaders down the stretch, passed tired rivals and took the third place moey. NOWNOWDANCER broke into the three path, was quickly corrected and showed speed as she gained on the early leader in the two path, chased the leader through the turn, was well placed and in contentions at the top of the lane but tired in mid stretch. DON'T LOOK ETHEL vied for the lead three wide on the outside, loomed up close but then tired. LADY KRISTEN showed little. MUCHO MACHO BABY made no impact. SEE YA BYE awkward start, never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Shesthebiggame
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, settled off pace, shifted out 1/4, closed

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: BGT, LLC., Frank Taylor Family & GeorgeE. Saufley

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Writ
ENTRY.OWNER: L and N Racing LLC and Brewster Clark O
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, mid pack, 3w, encouraged 3/8, shifted rail, closed, 2nd

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 60. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CITY GHOST was fractious loading, broke sharp, angled to the rail, established his position on the rail, set every fraction, won like it was no contest, all alone on the lead. super game. CINCO GAL chased the winner through out and was second best today. COLLECTED DREAMS was bumped and angled into the rail in a ninety degree turn by a rival on his outside, was guided by his jockey to stop and then travel down the track and chase the rest of their competitors, gathered himself up and found his stride, accelerated and improved position along the rail, found clean racing room saved ground the whole trip but had to settle for third today. Still a game effort. FOREIGN TOURIST maintained position through out. SIBERIANA stalked briefly and then faded. BETONYA was never involved.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 11000. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: UPTOWN SOCIAL advanced up the rail, vied for the lead, was able to secure the rail, attended the pace, drew off uncontested. Much the best. FIVE O FOX vied for the lead, raced two wide while stalking the leader, chased into the lane and to the wire., was second best today. DEPUTY KNIGHT vied for the lead from in between horses, shuffled back and raced from off the pace in the five path, started gaining ground at the half mile pole, continued to gain momentum into the stretch, closed but to no avail. IRON MOON was off a touch slow, raced three wide and moved up in between horses, mild gain. JARED THE WARRIOR was off slow, settled off the pace while racing in the four path, was encouraged and kept closing and passed tired rivals. PERIPATETIC raced two wide, stalked briefly then shuffled back and maintained his position after that. OLD TOBY vied for the lead early on from the three path, stalked the early pace until the three eighths pole and faded.

ENTRY.NAME: Uptown Social
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, rail, led, drew off, much the best

ENTRY.NAME: Peripatetic
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, stalked early, shuffled back, maintained position

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy Knight
ENTRY.COMMENT: btwn, shuffled back, 5w, closed, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Jared the Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC and Cimarron TTT Farms LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, 4w, passed tired foes

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 7 1/2F Turf CR: 64. Claiming Purse 18000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards) (Rail at 20 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHIEFWEAVE showed early speed, was racing from the three path, was still out in the three path advancing into the turn, rated a bit and controlled the pace to his liking, was first into the furlong ground, was driven and encouraged, stayed on point, was threatened in the last few jumps but had done enough early and held on for a well deserved win. KINGS WAGER vied for the early lead from the four path, stalked the leader from the outside in company with a rival on the rail, briefly was joined by another foe on the outside and raced in between, was asked at the half mile pole and advanced still in a set with his inside rival chasing the leader, entered the stretch, shook the inside rival, angled down to the fence, had aim on the leader, was closing in with each stride, but the eventual winner reached the wire before he could over come him and had to settle for second. MAGIC LIGHTNING raced along the rail in a stalking position, was joined by an outside foe, raced in set chasing the leader into the stretch, tired late. KINGPRIN raced in between horses off the pace but made no impact. FLASHBACK WIND was off a step slow, raced in the two path, saved ground and improved position in the stretch but to no avail. FLASHBACK WIND WAS VANNED OFF AFTER THE WIRE. JUDGMENTAL was well off the pace early, saved ground and raced along the fence throughout, was gaining ground and had improved position, was slightly steadied going into the turn, raced flat through the stretch. DARK MATTER showed little. YOU YOUR DADDY SON flashed early speed, raced three to four wide, then tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Judgmental
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, saved ground, rail, gained ground, slightly steadied,

ENTRY.NAME: Chiefweave
ENTRY.COMMENT: showed early spd, vied, led, rated, set the pace, 4w, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Flashback Wind
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, 2w, closed stretch, but to no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Kings Wager
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 4w, stalked, btwn, mved 1/2, rail strtch, closed, jstmissed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 7F Dirt CR: 51. Maiden Claiming Purse 14000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SWEET LITTLE ROSE stalked along the rail, improved position and angled out into the two path. challenged for the lead at the quarter pole, slowly closed in on the early leader, captured the lead after the sixteenth pole and dew away in the last few strides for the win. SMILING ANGEL vied for the led, raced on the rail, set the pace, was challenged at the quarter pole, dug in and battled on but gave way late. BROADWAY PEARL raced from off the pace in between horses from the four path, improved position on the outside, through the tun, continued to close in the stretch with encouragement but could not gain any better placing and finished third. GOTTEMINABIND was racing mid pack from the four path, was asked at the half mile pole, continued to close, was encouraged at the quarter pole, drifted out a bit in the stretch, but had no late kick. DANCING TRICK made no impact. COURT COSTS showed early speed, vied for the lead, then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Smiling Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, battled 1/4, gave way, up for second.

ENTRY.NAME: Broadway Pearl
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 4w, closed up for third

ENTRY.NAME: Gotteminabind
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 4w, advanced 1/2, was encouraged 1/4, no late kick

ENTRY.NAME: Court Costs
ENTRY.OWNER: Smith Mike Smith Daria and East Austin Racing Stables LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 82. Claiming Purse 13750. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 30, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRAPPE VALLEY vied for the lead, settled in between horsed on the front end, was let out at the half and established the lead, continued inching out further through the turn was given his cue at the quarter pole and drew off to win by many. BREW CREW stalked four wide, moved at the half, advanced and improved position on the out side, was encouraged and closed in the stretch but did not have enough today for the win but ran a good second. CORVETTE SPIRIT vied for the early lead, raced from the three path, matched strides in a three way set on the front end, gave way late. TAPPIN FORA DANCE showed litte. STOMPING HOTROD made no impact. BODEE BODEE trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Tappin Fora Dance
ENTRY.OWNER: Huff Ronnie Bone Danny and Booth Danny

ENTRY.NAME: Trappe Valley
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, btwn, pulled in front, drew off

ENTRY.NAME: Corvette Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, 3w, matched on the front, gave way late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 8 5F Turf CR: 89. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 31000. FOR ACCREDITED LA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $12,500. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 30 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances). (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs) (Rail at 20 fe et).

CLAIM.OWNER: L and G Racing Stables and Castillo Silvia

RACE.FOOTNOTES: SATURDAY'S GOLD vied for the early lead, matched strides on the from end with another rival from the three path, accelerated through the turn, cornered beautifully entering the stretch and took command, then drew off to win easily. MORRICONE raced mid pack in between horses, improved position, racing in the three path, battled in the stretch and prevailed for the second. BISPING stalked the early leader, stayed in contention through out, was in a battle coming down the stretch and was up for third. SABER RUN raced from off the pace, closed with a mild bid. GOLD MERRITT vied for the early lead, settled, stalked, tired late. PEPPER JACK was off a step slow, gathered himself up and found his stride, improved position late. TARGET PRACTICE stalked the early pace while racing in the three path, maintained position until the sixteenth pole, but had no late kick. MR. FOUR SEVENS was off a bit slow, raced four wide and made no impact. JAKE THE BAND MAN showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Morricone
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, 3w, improved position, battled stretch, prevailed

ENTRY.NAME: Saturday's Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, co-led, took over entering stretch, drew off
